en: He knew that when he returned to the firehouse, he might wink at himself, a minstrel man, burnt-corked, in the mirror. Later, going to sleep, he would feel the fiery smile still gripped by his face muscles, in the dark. It never went away, that. smile, it never ever went away, as long as he remembered.
vi: Anh biết rằng khi anh quay lại trạm phóng hỏa, anh có thể nháy mắt với chính mình, một nghệ nhân lang thang, đen nhẻm như bần cháy, ở trong gương. Sau đó, đi ngủ, anh sẽ cảm thấy cái nụ cười dữ dằn kia vẫn còn được các cơ mặt mình giữ chặt, trong bóng tối. Nó chả bao giờ biến đi hẳn, cái nụ cười ấy, nó chẳng bao giờ đi hẳn, theo như anh còn nhớ được.
tr: İtfaiye merkezine döndüğünde biliyordu ki, yanık mantar gibi zenciye benzemiş yüzüyle aynaya bakıp kendine göz kırpacaktı. Daha sonra ise, uykuya dalarken, karanlıkta, yüz kaslarının yakaladığı alev alev gülümsemeyi hissedecekti. Anımsadığı sürece, o gülümseme hiçbir zaman silinmeyecek ve yok olmayacaktı.
es: Sabía que, cuando regresase al cuartel de bomberos, se miraría pestañeando en el espejo: su rostro sería el de un negro de opereta, tiznado con corcho ahumado. Luego, al irse a dormir, sentiría la fiera sonrisa retenida aún en la oscuridad por sus músculos faciales. Esa sonrisa nunca desaparecía, nunca había desaparecido hasta donde él podía recordar.
vi_translation: He knew that when he returned to the fire station, he might wink at himself, a wandering artist, as black as charred wood, in the mirror. After that, going to sleep, he would feel that fierce smile still held tight by his facial muscles, in the dark. It never completely disappeared, that smile, it never completely went away, as far as he could remember.
tr_translation: When he returned to the fire station, he knew that he would look in the mirror at his face, which had turned black like a burnt mushroom, and wink at himself. Later, as he fell asleep, he would feel the fiery smile his facial muscles had captured in the dark. As long as he remembered, that smile would never fade or disappear.
es_translation: He knew that, when he returned to the fire station, he would look at himself blinking in the mirror: his face would be that of a minstrel, blackened with smoked cork. Then, when he went to sleep, he would feel the fierce smile still held in the darkness by his facial muscles. That smile never disappeared, it had never disappeared as far back as he could remember.

en: But now, tonight, he slowed almost to a stop. His inner mind, reaching out to turn the corner for him, had heard the faintest whisper. Breathing? Or was the atmosphere compressed merely by someone standing very quietly there, waiting?
vi: Nhưng đêm nay, anh chậm bước lại đến mức gần như dừng hẳn. Tâm trí anh, vươn ra đằng trước để rẽ nơi khúc quanh thay cho thể xác, đã nghe được tiếng thì thầm hết sức khẽ khàng. Tiếng thở ư? Hay là bầu không khí bị nén lại chỉ vì có ai đó hết sức lặng lẽ đứng đấy, chờ đợi?
tr: Fakat şimdi, bu gece, neredeyse duracak kadar yavaşladı. İçeriden çıkıp onun için köşeyi dönen zihni, en zayıfından bir fısıltı duydu. Bir soluk muydu? Yoksa birisi orada sessizce ayakta durup, havada yarattığı basınçla bekliyor muydu?
es: Pero esa noche, Montag aminoró el paso casi hasta detenerse. Su subconsciente, adelantándosele a doblar la esquina, había oído un debilísimo susurro. ¿De respiración? ¿O era la atmósfera, comprimida únicamente por alguien que estuviese allí muy quieto, esperando?
vi_translation: But tonight, he slowed his steps to the point of almost stopping completely. His mind, reaching forward to turn the corner in place of his body, had heard the faintest whisper. A breath? Or was it the air compressed simply because someone was standing there very quietly, waiting?
tr_translation: But now, tonight, it slowed down to almost a halt. His mind, stepping out from inside and turning the corner for him, heard the faintest of whispers. Was it a breath? Or was someone standing there quietly, waiting with the pressure they created in the air?
es_translation: But that night, Montag slowed down almost to a stop. His subconscious, rounding the corner ahead of him, had heard a very faint whisper. Was it breathing? Or was it the atmosphere, compressed only by someone who was there very still, waiting?

en: He felt she was walking in a circle about him, turning him end for end, shaking him quietly, and emptying his pockets, without once moving herself.
vi: Anh cảm thấy nàng đang lượn vòng xung quanh anh, xoay anh từ bên này qua bên kia, khẽ lắc anh, và dốc rỗng hết các túi của anh, trong khi nàng không hề nhúc nhích.
tr: Montag, kızın sanki etrafında dönerek yürüdüğünü, tepeden tırnağa incelediğini, onu sessizce silkelediğini ve hiç kımıldamadan ceplerini boşalttığını hissediyordu.
es: Montag sintió que ella andaba en círculo a su alrededor, le examinaba de extremo a extremo, sacudiéndolo silenciosamente y vaciándole los bolsillos, aunque, en realidad, no se moviera en absoluto.
vi_translation: He felt her circling around him, turning him from side to side, gently shaking him, and emptying all his pockets, while she did not move at all.
tr_translation: Montag felt as if the girl was walking around him, examining him from head to toe, silently shaking him, and emptying his pockets without making a sound.
es_translation: Montag felt that she was walking in circles around him, examining him from head to toe, silently shaking him and emptying his pockets, even though, in reality, she did not move at all.

en: There was only the girl walking with him now, her face bright as snow in the moonlight, and he knew she was working his questions around, seeking the best answers she could possibly give.
vi: Lúc này chỉ có cô gái đang đi cùng anh, khuôn mặt nàng sáng như tuyết dưới ánh trăng, và anh biết nàng đang lật đi lật lại những câu hỏi của anh, tìm câu trả lòi tốt nhất để đáp lại.
tr: Şimdi yanında yalnızca yürüyen kız vardı, yüzü ay ışığında kar gibi beyazdı ve sorduğu sorulara kızın düşünüp en iyi cevapları vermeye çalıştığını biliyordu Montag.
es: Sólo había la muchacha andando a su lado, con su rostro que brillaba como la nieve al claro de luna, y Montag comprendió que estaba meditando las preguntas que él le había formulado, buscando las mejores respuestas.
vi_translation: At this moment, there was only the girl walking with him, her face bright as snow under the moonlight, and he knew she was turning his questions over and over, searching for the best answer to give back.
tr_translation: Now, the only one walking beside him was the girl, her face as white as snow in the moonlight, and Montag knew that she was trying to think and give the best answers to the questions he asked.
es_translation: There was only the girl walking beside him, with her face shining like snow in the moonlight, and Montag understood that she was pondering the questions he had asked her, searching for the best answers.

en: “I sometimes think drivers don't know what grass is, or flowers, because they never see them slowly,” she said. “If you showed a driver a green blur, Oh yes! he'd say, that's grass! A pink blur? That's a rose-garden! White blurs are houses. Brown blurs are cows. My uncle drove slowly on a highway once. He drove forty miles an hour and they jailed him for two days. Isn't that funny, and sad, too?”
vi: "Đôi khi em nghĩ những người lái kia chẳng biết cỏ hay hoa là cái gì, bởi họ chẳng bao giờ nhìn chúng một cách chậm rãi hết," nàng nói. "Nếu anh cho một tay tài xế xem một vệt mờ màu xanh lục thì, Ồ vâng, là cỏ đây, y ta sẽ nói. Một vệt mờ màu hồng? ừ thì một vườn hồng! Những vệt mờ màu trắng là nhà cửa. Vệt mờ màu nâu là mấy con bò. Ông bác em có lần lái xe chậm trên xa lộ. Bác ấy lái bốn mươi dặm một giờ, thế là người ta giam bác ấy hai ngày. Chuyện ấy chẳng phải tức cười sao, mà cũng buồn nữa?"
tr: “Ben bazen sürücülerin çimen ya da çiçek nedir bilmediklerini düşünüyorum. Çünkü onları asla yavaş gidip göremezler,” dedi Clarisse. “Eğer yeşil bir şey gösterirseniz, ‘Oh evet, bu çimen,’ derler. Pembe bir şey gösterirsen, ‘Bir gül bahçesi,’ derler. Beyaz şekillerse binalardır. Kahverengi şekiller ise inekler. Amcam bir kez karayollarında arabayı yavaş sürüyordu. Arabayı saatte 40 mille sürdü ve onu iki gün hapse attılar. Çok komik ve de acı değil mi?
es: —A veces, pienso que sus conductores no saben cómo es la hierba, ni las flores, porque nunca las ven con detenimiento —dijo ella—. Si le mostrase a uno de esos chóferes una borrosa mancha verde, diría: ¡Oh, sí, es hierba! ¿Una mancha borrosa de color rosado? ¡Es una rosaleda! Las manchas blancas son casas. Las manchas pardas son vacas. Una vez, mi tío condujo lentamente por una carretera. Condujo a sesenta y cinco kilómetros por hora y lo encarcelaron por dos días. ¿No es curioso, y triste también?
vi_translation: "Sometimes I think those drivers don't know what grass or flowers are, because they never look at them slowly," she said. "If you show a driver a blur of green, oh yes, that's grass, he would say. A blur of pink? Well, that's a rose garden! Blurs of white are houses. Blurs of brown are cows. My uncle once drove slowly on the highway. He drove forty miles an hour, so they jailed him for two days. Isn't that funny, but also sad?"
tr_translation: “Sometimes I think drivers don't know what grass or flowers are. Because they never slow down to see them,” said Clarisse. “If you show them something green, they’ll say, ‘Oh yes, that's grass,’ If you show them something pink, they’ll say, ‘A rose garden,’ White shapes are buildings. Brown shapes are cows. My uncle once drove slowly on the highways. He drove the car at 40 miles per hour and they put him in jail for two days. Isn't it very funny and also sad?”
es_translation: —Sometimes, I think that their drivers don't know what grass or flowers look like, because they never see them closely —she said—. If you showed one of those drivers a blurry green spot, they would say: Oh, yes, it's grass! A blurry pink spot? It's a rose garden! The white spots are houses. The brown spots are cows. Once, my uncle drove slowly down a road. He drove at sixty-five kilometers per hour and was jailed for two days. Isn't it curious, and sad too?

en: They walked the rest of the way in silence, hers thoughtful, his a kind of clenching and uncomfortable silence in which he shot her accusing glances. When they reached her house all its lights were blazing.
vi: Họ đi bộ nốt đoạn đường còn lại trong im lặng, nàng im lặng trầm ngâm, còn anh thì một thứ im lặng bức bối khó chịu, thỉnh thoảng anh lại liếc nhìn nàng như thể kết tội. Khi họ về đến nhà nàng, tất cả đèn đóm đều sáng trưng.
tr: Yolun geri kalan kısmında sessizce yürüdüler. Clarisse’in suskunluğu düşünceli, Montag’ınki ise kızın kendisini suçlayan bakışları altında sıkıntılı ve huzursuzdu. Kızın evine ulaştıklarında, bütün ışıklar ışıl ışıldı. Montag bu kadar çok ışığı yanan bir ev görmezdi pek.
es: Recorrieron en silencio el resto del camino. El de ella, pensativo, el de él, irritado e incómodo, acusando el impacto de las miradas inquisitivas de la muchacha. Cuando llegaron a la casa de ella, todas sus luces estaban encendidas.
vi_translation: They walked the rest of the way in silence, she in contemplative silence, while he in a tense, uncomfortable silence, occasionally glancing at her as if accusing. When they arrived at her house, all the lights were on.
tr_translation: They walked the rest of the way in silence. Clarisse's silence was thoughtful, while Montag's was troubled and uneasy under the girl's accusatory gaze. When they reached the girl's house, all the lights were brightly lit. Montag rarely saw a house with so many lights on.
es_translation: They walked the rest of the way in silence. Her steps were thoughtful, his were irritated and uncomfortable, feeling the impact of the girl's inquisitive glances. When they arrived at her house, all its lights were on.

en: He glanced back at the wall. How like a mirror, too, her face. Impossible; for how many people did you know that refracted your own light to you? People were more often-he searched for a simile, found one in his work-torches, blazing away until they whiffed out. How rarely did other people's faces take of you and throw back to you your own expression, your own innermost trembling thought?
vi: Anh lại liếc về bức tường. Mà giống cả một tấm gương nữa, giống làm sao, khuôn mặt nàng. Không thể được; vì liệu ta biết được bao nhiêu người khúc xạ ánh sáng của chính ta về lại cho ta kia chứ? Con người ta thường là - anh tìm một hình ảnh so sánh, và tìm thấy trong công việc mình làm - những ngọn đuốc, cứ bùng cháy cho đến khi rụi hết. Thật họa hoằn làm sao những khi khuôn mặt người khác thu nhận ta và ném trả lại ta biểu lộ của chính ta, cái suy nghĩ run rẩy sâu kín nhất của ta?
tr: Montag tekrar duvara bir göz attı. Clarisse’in yüzü nasıl da aynaya benziyordu. Olanaksız; sizin ışığınızı size yansıtan kaç kişi tanırsınız? Bir benzetme aradı ve Montag kendi işinden buldu; insanlar daha çok bir meşaleye benziyorlardı; birileri üfleyinceye kadar yanarlardı. Ne kadar nadir diğer insanların yüzleri sizi sizden alıp, kendi duygularınızı, en derin titrek düşüncelerinizi size yansıtırdı?
es: Volvió a mirar la pared. El rostro de ella también se parecía mucho a un espejo. Imposible, ¿cuánta gente había que refractase hacia uno su propia luz? Por lo general, la gente era —Montag buscó un símil, lo encontró en su trabajo— como antorchas, que ardían hasta consumirse. ¡Cuán pocas veces los rostros de las otras personas captaban algo tuyo y te devolvían tu propia expresión, tus pensamientos más íntimos!
vi_translation: He glanced back at the wall. It was also like a mirror, how similar, her face. Impossible; for how many people do we know who refract our own light back to us? People are often - he searched for a comparison, and found it in his work - like torches, burning until they are completely consumed. How rare it is when someone else's face captures us and reflects back our own expression, our deepest, trembling thoughts?
tr_translation: Montag glanced at the wall again. How much Clarisse's face resembled a mirror. Impossible; how many people do you know who reflect your light back to you? He searched for a metaphor and found one from his own work; people were more like torches; they burned until someone blew them out. How rare it was for other people's faces to take you away from yourself and reflect your own feelings, your deepest trembling thoughts back to you?
es_translation: He looked back at the wall. Her face also resembled a mirror very much. Impossible, how many people were there who refracted one's own light back at them? Generally, people were —Montag searched for a simile, found it in his work— like torches, burning until they consumed themselves. How rarely did the faces of other people capture something of yours and return your own expression, your most intimate thoughts!

en: What incredible power of identification the girl had; she was like the eager watcher of a marionette show, anticipating each flicker of an eyelid, each gesture of his hand, each flick of a finger, the moment before it began. How long had they walked together? Three minutes? Five? Yet how large that time seemed now. How immense a figure she was on the stage before him; what a shadow she threw on the wall with her slender body! He felt that if his eye itched, she might blink. And if the muscles of his jaws stretched imperceptibly, she would yawn long before he would.
vi: Cô gái này có cái khả năng đồng hóa vào ngoại thể thật đáng kinh ngạc; nàng giống như người háo hức xem một buổi diễn múa rối, đoán trước được từng cái nháy mắt, từng cử động của bàn tay anh, từng cái nhúc nhích của một ngón tay, một khoảnh khắc trước khi nó bắt đầu. Họ đi cùng nhau được bao lâu nhỉ? Ba phút? Năm? Thế nhưng khoảng thời gian đó giờ đây có vẻ dài làm sao. Hình ảnh nàng mới rợn ngợp làm sao trên cái sân khấu trước mặt anh; và bóng nàng hắt lên tường mới to lớn làm sao so với thân hình mảnh dẻ của nàng! Anh cảm thấy nếu mắt anh ngứa, nàng sẽ chớp mắt. Và nếu các cơ hàm anh duỗi ra nhẹ đến không thể nhận thấy, nàng sẽ ngáp trước khi anh ngáp.
tr: Kızın ne inanılmaz bir tanımlama gücü vardı. Kukla gösterisini hoşlanarak izleyen birine benziyordu. Göz kapağının her kıpırdanışını, elinin her jestini, parmağının hafif dokunuşlarını daha başlamadan tahmin ediyordu. Ne kadar süre birlikte yürümüşlerdi? Üç dakika mı yoksa beş dakika mı? Çok uzun bir süre gibi geliyordu ona. Önündeki sahnede kocaman bir figür oluşturmuştu; o incecik bedeniyle duvara ne büyük bir gölge yansıtmıştı. Montag gözü kaşınsa, Clarisse’in gözlerini kırpıştıracağını hissediyordu. Fark edilmez bir şekilde çene kasları gerilseydi, Clarisse ondan önce esneyecekti.
es: Aquella muchacha tenía un increíble poder de identificación; era como el ávido espectador de una función de marionetas, previendo cada parpadeo, cada movimiento de una mano, cada estremecimiento de un dedo, un momento antes de que sucediese. ¿Cuánto rato habían caminado juntos? ¿Tres minutos? ¿Cinco? Sin embargo, ahora le parecía un rato interminable. ¡Qué inmensa figura tenía ella en el escenario que se extendía ante sus ojos! ¡Qué sombra producía en la pared con su esbelto cuerpo! Montag se dio cuenta de que, si le picasen los ojos, ella pestañearía. Y de que si los músculos de sus mandíbulas se tensaran imperceptiblemente, ella bostezaría mucho antes de que lo hiciera él.
vi_translation: This girl has an incredible ability to assimilate into the external environment; she is like someone eagerly watching a puppet show, predicting every blink, every movement of his hand, every twitch of a finger, a moment before it begins. How long have they been together? Three minutes? Five? Yet that period now seems so long. How overwhelming her image is on the stage in front of him; and how large her shadow looms on the wall compared to her slender figure! He feels that if his eyes itch, she will blink. And if his jaw muscles stretch ever so slightly, she will yawn before he does.
tr_translation: The girl had an incredible power of description. She looked like someone who enjoyed watching a puppet show. She could predict every twitch of the eyelid, every gesture of the hand, every light touch of the finger before they even started. How long had they been walking together? Three minutes or five minutes? It felt like a very long time to him. In the scene before him, a huge figure had formed; with her slender body, she had cast a large shadow on the wall. Montag felt that if his eye itched, Clarisse would blink her eyes. If his jaw muscles tensed imperceptibly, Clarisse would yawn before him.
es_translation: That girl had an incredible power of identification; she was like the avid spectator of a puppet show, anticipating every blink, every hand movement, every finger twitch, a moment before it happened. How long had they walked together? Three minutes? Five? However, now it seemed like an endless time. What an immense figure she had on the stage that stretched out before his eyes! What a shadow she cast on the wall with her slender body! Montag realized that if his eyes itched, she would blink. And that if the muscles of his jaws tensed imperceptibly, she would yawn long before he did.

en: It was like coming into the cold marbled room of a mausoleum after the moon had set. Complete darkness, not a hint of the silver world outside, the windows tightly shut, the chamber a tomb-world where no sound from the great city could penetrate. The room was not empty.
vi: Giống như bước vào một căn phòng bằng đá hoa cương lạnh lẽo của một lăng mộ sau khi trăng đã lặn. Tối như bưng, không có một chút gì gợi đến thế giới màu bạc ở ngoài kia, cửa sổ đóng im ỉm, cái biệt phòng thuộc một chốn hầm mộ nơi không một âm thanh nào của thành phố lớn ngoài kia thâm nhập tới được. Căn phòng không trống.
tr: Ay kaybolduktan sonra, bir mozolenin soğuk mermer odasına girmek gibiydi. Tümüyle karanlık ortamda, dışarıdaki gümüş dünyanın izi yoktu; pencereler öylesine sıkı kapatılmıştı ki, koca şehrin gürültüsü içeriye, bir mezar gibi olan odaya sızamıyordu. Oda boş değildi.
es: Era como entrar en la fría sala de un mausoleo después de haberse puesto la luna. Oscuridad completa, ni un atisbo del plateado mundo exterior; las ventanas herméticamente cerradas convertían la habitación en un mundo de ultratumba en el que no podía penetrar ningún ruido de la gran ciudad. La habitación no estaba vacía.
vi_translation: It was like stepping into a cold marble room of a tomb after the moon had set. Pitch dark, with nothing hinting at the silver world outside, the windows tightly shut, the secluded room belonging to a crypt where no sound from the bustling city outside could penetrate. The room was not empty.
tr_translation: After the moon disappeared, it was like entering the cold marble chamber of a mausoleum. In the completely dark environment, there was no trace of the silver world outside; the windows were so tightly shut that the noise of the big city couldn't penetrate into the room, which was like a tomb. The room was not empty.
es_translation: It was like entering the cold hall of a mausoleum after the moon had set. Complete darkness, not a hint of the silvery outside world; the hermetically sealed windows turned the room into an underworld where no noise from the great city could penetrate. The room was not empty.

en: The room was cold but nonetheless he felt he could not breathe. He did not wish to open the curtains and open the french windows, for he did not want the moon to come into the room. So, with the feeling of a man who will die in the next hour for lack of air,.he felt his way toward his open, separate, and therefore cold bed.
vi: Căn phòng lạnh lẽo thế nhưng anh vẫn thấy không thể thở được. Anh không muốn kéo rèm và mở mấy ô cửa sổ kiểu Pháp, bởi anh không muốn ánh trăng tràn vào phòng. Thế nên, với cảm giác mình như kẻ một giờ nữa sẽ chết vì thiếu không khí, anh mò mẫm đi về phía cái giường còn trống, tách biệt và do đó lạnh lẽo của mình.
tr: Oda soğuktu, yine de Montag rahat soluk alamadığını hissetti. Ay ışığının odaya girmesini istemediği için perdeleri ve panjurları açmak içinden gelmedi. Bir saat sonra kendini havasızlıktan ölecek bir adam gibi hissederek, üstü açık, ayrı, dolayısıyla da soğuk yatağına doğru ilerledi.
es: La habitación era fresca; sin embargo, Montag sintió que no podía respirar. No quería correr las cortinas y abrir los ventanales, porque no deseaba que la luna penetrara en el cuarto. Por lo tanto, con la sensación de un hombre que ha de morir en menos de una hora, por falta de aire que respirar, se dirigió a tientas hacia su cama abierta, separada y, en consecuencia fría.
vi_translation: The room was cold, yet he still felt like he couldn't breathe. He didn't want to draw the curtains and open the French windows because he didn't want the moonlight to flood the room. So, with the feeling that he was like someone who would die from lack of air in an hour, he groped his way towards his empty, isolated, and therefore cold bed.
tr_translation: The room was cold, yet Montag felt he couldn't breathe comfortably. He didn't feel like opening the curtains and blinds because he didn't want the moonlight to enter the room. An hour later, feeling like a man who would die from lack of air, he moved towards his open, separate, and therefore cold bed.
es_translation: The room was cool; however, Montag felt that he couldn't breathe. He didn't want to draw the curtains and open the windows, because he didn't want the moon to enter the room. Therefore, with the feeling of a man who is to die in less than an hour due to lack of air to breathe, he groped his way towards his open, separated, and consequently cold bed.

en: The object he had sent tumbling with his foot now glinted under the edge of his own bed. The small crystal bottle of sleeping-tablets which earlier today had been filled with thirty capsules and which now lay uncapped and empty in the light of the tiny flare.
vi: Cái vật anh vừa đá đổ chỏng chơ lúc này nằm sáng óng ánh dưới mép giường anh. Cái chai pha lê nhỏ đựng thuốc ngủ mới sáng sớm hôm nay còn đầy ba chục viên con nhộng, bây giờ nằm đó, mở nắp, rỗng không dưới ánh sáng ngọn lửa nhỏ xíu.
tr: Ayağıyla çarpıp yuvarladığı nesne, kendi yatağının kenarının altında parlıyordu. Günün erken saatlerinde içinde otuz uyku ilacının olduğu küçük kristal şişe, şimdi bomboş ve kapaksız olarak yerde duruyor, cılız alevin ışığında görünüyordu.
es: El objeto que él había enviado a rodar con el pie resplandeció bajo el borde de su propia cama. La botellita de cristal previamente llena con treinta píldoras para dormir y que, ahora, aparecía destapada y vacía a la luz de su encendedor.
vi_translation: The object you just kicked over is now lying glittering under the edge of your bed. The small crystal bottle that held sleeping pills, which was full with thirty capsules just this morning, now lies there, uncapped and empty under the light of a tiny flame.
tr_translation: The object he kicked and rolled with his foot was shining under the edge of his own bed. The small crystal bottle that had thirty sleeping pills in it earlier in the day was now empty and without a cap, lying on the floor, visible in the light of the faint flame.
es_translation: The object he had sent rolling with his foot glistened under the edge of his own bed. The small glass bottle previously filled with thirty sleeping pills, now appeared uncapped and empty in the light of his lighter.

en: He felt that the stars had been pulverized by the sound of the black jets and that in the morning the earth would be thought as he stood shivering in the dark, and let his lips go on moving and moving.
vi: Anh cảm thấy các vì sao đã rụm ra thành bụi vì âm thanh những chiếc phản lực đen và sáng ra mặt đất sẽ phủ kín bụi của chúng như một thứ tuyết lạ. Đó là ý nghĩ ngu ngốc của anh khi anh đứng đó run rẩy trong bóng tối, để cho mồi mình động đậy, động đậy mãi không thôi.
tr: Kara jetlerin sesiyle yıldızların parçalanıp toz haline geldiğini ve sabah olduğunda bütün dünyanın bu tozla sanki tuhaf bir karmış gibi kaplanacağını hissetti. Bu aptalca düşünceyle karanlıkta titrerken, dudakları devamlı hareket ediyordu.
es: Montag sintió que las estrellas habían sido pulverizadas por el sonido de los negros reactores, y que por la mañana la tierra estaría cubierta con su polvo, como si se tratara de una extraña nieve. Aquél fue el absurdo pensamiento que se le ocurrió mientras se estremecía en la oscuridad, mientras sus labios seguían moviéndose.
vi_translation: He felt that the stars had crumbled into dust because the sound of the black jets and the light on the ground would cover their dust like a strange kind of snow. That was his foolish thought as he stood there trembling in the dark, letting his bait move, move endlessly.
tr_translation: He felt that with the sound of the black jets, the stars would shatter into dust and that by morning, the whole world would be covered with this dust as if it were some strange mixture. While trembling in the dark with this foolish thought, his lips were constantly moving.
es_translation: Montag felt that the stars had been pulverized by the sound of the black jets, and that by morning the earth would be covered with their dust, as if it were a strange snow. That was the absurd thought that occurred to him as he trembled in the darkness, while his lips kept moving.

en: “Sure, she'll be O.K. We got all the mean stuff right in our suitcase here, it can't get at her now. As I said, you take out the old and put in the new and you're O.K.”
vi: "Chắc rồi, cô ấy sẽ ổn. Chúng tôi thu sạch cái thứ chết giẫm ấy vào va li đây rồi, nó không động tới cô ấy được nữa đâu. Như tôi nói ấy, ta rút thứ cũ ra, cho thứ mới vào, thế là ngon lành."
tr: “Tabii, iyi olacak. Bütün gerekli şeyler çantamızın içinde. Şu anda başka şey gerekmiyor. Söylediğim gibi, eskisini çıkartıp, yenisini koyarsınız olur biter.
es: —¡Claro que se curará! Nos llevamos todo el veneno en esa maleta y, ahora, ya no puede afectarle. Como he dicho, se saca lo viejo, se pone lo nuevo y quedan mejor que nunca.
vi_translation: "Sure, she will be fine. We've packed that damned thing into the suitcase, it can't get to her anymore. As I said, we take the old thing out, put the new one in, and it's all good."
tr_translation: “Of course, it will be fine. All the necessary things are in our bag. Right now, nothing else is needed. As I said, you just take out the old one and put in the new one, and that's it.”
es_translation: —Of course he will get better! We took all the poison in that suitcase and now it can't affect him. As I said, you take out the old, put in the new, and they are better than ever.

en: “It's really fun. It'll be even more fun when we can afford to have the fourth wall installed. How long you figure before we save up and get the fourth wall torn out and a fourth wall-TV put in? It's only two thousand dollars.”
vi: "Vui lắm nhé. Chừng nào nhà mình đủ sức lắp được bức tường thứ tư thì còn vui hơn nữa. Theo anh thì bao lâu nữa hai đứa mình mới tiết kiệm đủ tiền để dở bức tường thứ tư ra đặng lắp cái ti vi tường thứ tư vào? Có hai ngàn đô thôi mà."
tr: “Gerçekten eğlenceli. Dördüncü duvarı da satın alıp monte ettirirsek, daha da eğlenceli olur. Dördüncü duvarın sökülüp duvar TV’si olabilmesi için ne kadar zamanda para biriktirebiliriz? Sadece iki bin dolar gerekiyor.
es: —Es muy distraída. Y aún lo será más cuando podamos instalar televisión en la cuarta pared. ¿Cuánto crees que tardaremos ahora para poder sustituir esa pared por otra con televisión? Sólo cuesta dos mil dólares.
vi_translation: "It's very fun. When our family has enough resources to install the fourth wall, it will be even more fun. According to you, how long will it take for the two of us to save enough money to remove the fourth wall and install the fourth wall TV? It's only two thousand dollars."
tr_translation: “Really fun. If we buy and install the fourth wall, it will be even more fun. How long would it take to save up enough money for the fourth wall to be dismantled and turned into a wall TV? We only need two thousand dollars.”
es_translation: —She is very distracted. And she will be even more so when we can install a television on the fourth wall. How long do you think it will take now to be able to replace that wall with another one with a television? It only costs two thousand dollars.

en: “I am very much in love!” He tried to conjure up a face to fit the words, but there was no face. “I am ! “
vi: "Tôi có yêu, yêu rất nhiều!" Anh cố rặn ra một khuôn mặt tương thích với lời nói, nhưng chẳng có khuôn mặt nào. "Tôi có yêu!"
tr: “Hem de çok âşığım!” Montag yüzüne sözcüklere uygun bir anlam vermeye çalıştı, ama öyle bir yüz yoktu. “Âşığım.
es: —¡Estoy muy enamorado! —Montag trató de evocar un rostro que encajara con sus palabras, pero no lo encontró—. ¡Sí que lo estoy!
vi_translation: "I do love, love very much!" He tried to force a facial expression that matched his words, but there was no such expression. "I do love!"
tr_translation: "And I'm very much in love!" Montag tried to give his face an expression that matched the words, but there was no such face. "I'm in love."
es_translation: —I am very much in love! —Montag tried to evoke a face that matched his words, but he couldn't find one—. Yes, I am!

en: He saw the silver needle extended upon the air an inch, pull back, extend, pull back. The growl simmered in the beast and it looked at him.
vi: Anh thấy mũi kim bạc thòi ra hai ba phân trong không khí, rụt lại, thòi ra, thụt lại. Tiếng gừ gừ âm ỉ bên trong con thú và nó nhìn anh.
tr: Gümüş iğnenin havada iki santim uzadığını gördü; çekiliyor, uzuyor, çekiliyordu. Hayvan hırlamayı kesmiş, ona bakıyordu.
es: Vio que la aguja plateada asomaba un par de centímetros, volvía a ocultarse, asomaba un par de centímetros, volvía a ocultarse, asomaba, se ocultaba. El gruñido se acentuó, la bestia miró a Montag.
vi_translation: He saw the silver needle protruding two or three centimeters into the air, retracting, protruding, retracting. The low growl rumbled inside the beast as it looked at him.
tr_translation: He saw the silver needle extend two centimeters in the air; it was retracting, extending, retracting. The animal had stopped growling and was looking at him.
es_translation: He saw that the silver needle protruded a couple of centimeters, then hid again, protruded a couple of centimeters, then hid again, protruded, then hid. The growl intensified, the beast looked at Montag.

en: “Come off it. It doesn't like or dislike. It just `functions.' It's like a lesson in ballistics. It has a trajectory we decide for it. It follows through. It targets itself, homes itself, and cuts off. It's only copper wire, storage batteries, and electricity.”
vi: "Thôi nào. Nó chả thích cũng chả không thích. Nó chỉ 'làm đúng chức năng'. Nó giống như một bài học về đạn đạo. Nó có một quỹ đạo mà chứng ta định ra cho nó. Nó cứ thế theo. Nó tự nhắm mồi, tự về nhà, tự tắt. Nó chỉ là cáp đồng, pin và điện."
tr: “Boş ver. O ne sever ne de sevmez. O sadece ‘işler’. Balistikteki bir ders gibi. Bizim karar verdiğimiz bir rotası vardır. O takip eder, hesaplar, hedefi bulur ve iş bitirir. Bakır tellerden, pillerden ve elektrikten başka bir şey değil.
es: Olvídate de ello. Ése no quiere ni odia. Simplemente, funciona. Es como una lección de balística. Tiene una trayectoria que nosotros determinamos. Él la sigue rigurosamente. Persigue el blanco, lo alcanza, y nada más. Sólo es alambre de cobre, baterías de carga y electricidad.
vi_translation: "Come on." It neither liked nor disliked. It just 'performed its function'. It was like a lesson in ballistics. It had a trajectory that we set for it. It just followed it. It self-targeted, self-returned, self-shut down. It was just copper wire, batteries, and electricity."
tr_translation: “Never mind. It neither loves nor hates. It just 'works'. Like a lesson in ballistics. It has a course that we decide. It follows, calculates, finds the target, and finishes the job. Nothing but copper wires, batteries, and electricity.”
es_translation: Forget about it. It neither wants nor hates. It simply functions. It's like a ballistics lesson. It has a trajectory that we determine. It follows it rigorously. It chases the target, reaches it, and nothing more. It's just copper wire, charging batteries, and electricity.

en: “But most of all,” she said, “I like to watch people. Sometimes I ride the subway all day and look at them and listen to them. I just want to figure out who they are and what they want and where they're going. Sometimes I even go to the Fun Parks and ride in the jet cars when they race on the edge of town at midnight and the police don't care as long as they're insured. As long as everyone has ten thousand insurance everyone's happy. Sometimes I sneak around and listen in subways. Or I listen at soda fountains, and do you know what?”
vi: "Nhưng trên hết," nàng nói, "em thích nhìn thiên hạ. Đôi khi em đi tàu điện ngầm suốt ngày chỉ để nhìn và lắng nghe mọi người. Em chỉ muốn hình dung họ là ai, họ muốn gì, họ đi đâu. Đôi khi em đến công viên giải trí và lên ngồi trên mấy chiếc xe phản lực khi người ta đua xe ven thành phố lúc nửa đêm và cảnh sát chả buồn bận tâm chừng nào xe ấy có bảo hiểm. Chừng nào mà ai cũng có mười ngàn đồng bảo hiểm thì ai cũng vui vẻ. Đôi khi em nấp quanh mà lắng nghe trên tàu điện ngầm. Hay em lắng nghe ở các quầy nước giải khát, và anh biết sao không?"
tr: “Fakat hepsinden çok,” dedi Clarisse, “insanları izlemeyi severim. Bazen bütün gün metroya biner, onlara bakar ve onları dinlerim. Yalnızca kim olduklarını, ne istediklerini ve nereye gittiklerini kestirmek isterim. Bazen lunaparka gider, gece yarısı şehrin sınırında yarıştıklarında jet arabalara binerim. Onlar sigortalı olduğu sürece polis pek ilgilenmez. Herkesin on binlik sigortası olduğu sürece, herkes hayatından memnun. Bazen gezinirim ve metrolarda insanları dinlerim. Ya da büfelerde dinlerim ve biliyor musun neyi?
es: Pero por encima de todo —prosiguió diciendo Clarisse—, me gusta observar a la gente. A veces, me paso el día entero en el «Metro», y los contemplo y los escucho. Sólo deseo saber qué son, qué desean y adónde van. A veces, incluso voy a los parques de atracciones y monto en los coches cohetes cuando recorren los arrabales de la ciudad a medianoche y la Policía no se mete con ellos con tal de que estén asegurados. Con tal de que todos tengan un seguro de diez mil, todos contentos. A veces, me deslizo a hurtadillas y escucho en el «Metro». O en las cafeterías. Y, ¿sabe qué?
vi_translation: "But above all," she said, "I like watching people. Sometimes I ride the subway all day just to watch and listen to everyone. I just want to imagine who they are, what they want, where they are going. Sometimes I go to amusement parks and sit on those jet cars when people race around the city at midnight and the police don't bother as long as the cars are insured. As long as everyone has ten thousand dollars in insurance, everyone is happy. Sometimes I hide around and listen on the subway. Or I listen at soda fountains, and you know what?"
tr_translation: “But most of all,” said Clarisse, “I love watching people. Sometimes I ride the subway all day, looking at them and listening to them. I just want to guess who they are, what they want, and where they are going. Sometimes I go to the amusement park and ride the jet cars at midnight on the outskirts of the city. As long as they are insured, the police don't care much. As long as everyone has a ten-thousand-dollar insurance, everyone is happy with their life. Sometimes I wander and listen to people on the subways. Or I listen at the snack bars, and do you know what?”
es_translation: But above all — Clarisse continued saying —, I like to observe people. Sometimes, I spend the whole day in the "Metro," and I watch them and listen to them. I just want to know what they are, what they want, and where they are going. Sometimes, I even go to amusement parks and ride the rocket cars when they go through the outskirts of the city at midnight and the Police don't bother them as long as they are insured. As long as everyone has a ten-thousand insurance, everyone is happy. Sometimes, I sneak in and listen in the "Metro." Or in the cafes. And, you know what?

en: “ 'Play the man, Master Ridley; we shall this day light such a candle, by God's grace, in England, as I trust shall never be put out.' “
vi: " 'Hãy can đảm lên, Thầy Ridley; hôm nay ta sẽ thắp lên một ngọn nến, nhờ ơn Chúa, ở nước Anh, ngọn nến mà tôi tin sẽ không bao giờ bị dập tắt."
tr: “Mertçe davranın, Amir Ridley; İngiltere’de, Tanrı’nın izniyle öyle bir mum yakacağız ki, şu gün, eminim kimse asla söndüremeyecek.
es: —«Pórtate como un hombre, joven Ridley. Por la gracia de Dios, encenderemos hoy en Inglaterra tal hoguera que confío en que nunca se apagará.»
vi_translation: " 'Be of good cheer, Master Ridley; today we shall light such a candle, by God's grace, in England, as I trust shall never be put out."
tr_translation: "Act bravely, Amir Ridley; in England, with God's permission, we will light such a candle today that I am sure no one will ever be able to extinguish.""
es_translation: —"Behave like a man, young Ridley. By the grace of God, we will light such a fire in England today that I trust it will never be extinguished."

en: So it was the hand that started it all. He felt one hand and then the other work his coat free and let it slump to the floor. He held his pants out into an abyss and let them fall into darkness. His hands had been infected, and soon it would be his arms. He could feel the poison working up his wrists and into his elbows and his shoulders, and then the jump-over from shoulder-blade to shoulder-blade like a spark leaping a gap. His hands were ravenous. And his eyes were beginning to feel hunger, as if they must look at something, anything, everything.
vi: Vậy là chính bàn tay đã khỏi đầu tất cả. Anh cảm thấy một tay mình rồi sau đó đến tay kia cởi áo khoác ra rồi buông phịch áo xuống sàn. Anh chìa cái quần đang mặc vào một vực thẳm rồi thả cho nó rơi vào bóng tối. Hai bàn tay anh đã bị nhiễm trùng, rồi chẳng mấy chốc sẽ đến hai cánh tay. Anh có thể cảm thấy chất độc đang lan dần lên hai cổ tay, tiến vào hai cùi chỏ và hai vai anh, rồi sau đó nhảy cóc từ bả vai này sang bả vai kia như một tia lửa nhảy cóc qua một khoảng hẫng. Hai bàn tay anh đang đói cồn cào. Và mắt anh bắt đầu có cảm giác đói, như thể chúng phải nhìn một thứ gì đó, bất cứ thứ gì, mọi thứ.
tr: Her şeyi başlatan eliydi. Önce bir elinin, sonra diğerinin paltosunu açıp çıkarttığını, yere bıraktığını fark etti. Pantalonunu çıkarttı, cehennemdeki karanlığın içine doğru bıraktı. Elleri mikrop kapmıştı, birazdan kollarına da bulaşacaktı. Zehrin bileklerine, dirseklerine, omuzlarına, bir kürek kemiğinden diğerine doğru ilerlediğini, bir kıvılcım gibi atladığını hissedebiliyordu. Elleri canavarca acıkmıştı. Bakışları da acıkmaya başlamıştı, sanki bir şeye, herhangi bir şeye, her şeye bakmalıydılar.
es: De modo que era la mano que lo había empezado todo. Sintió una mano y, luego, la otra que desabrochaba su chaqueta y la dejaba caer en el suelo. Sostuvo sus pantalones sobre un abismo y los dejó caer en la oscuridad. Sus manos estaban hambrientas. Y sus ojos empezaban a estarlo también, como si tuviera necesidad de ver algo, cualquier cosa, todas las cosas.
vi_translation: So it was the very hands that started it all. He felt one hand, then the other, take off his coat and let it drop to the floor. He extended the pants he was wearing into an abyss and let them fall into the darkness. His hands were infected, and soon his arms would be too. He could feel the poison spreading up his wrists, into his elbows and shoulders, then leaping from one shoulder to the other like a spark jumping across a gap. His hands were ravenously hungry. And his eyes began to feel hungry, as if they had to see something, anything, everything.
tr_translation: It was the hand that started everything. First, he noticed one hand, then the other, opening and taking off his coat, and dropping it to the ground. He took off his pants and threw them into the darkness of hell. His hands were infected, and soon it would spread to his arms. He could feel the poison advancing from his wrists to his elbows, to his shoulders, leaping like a spark from one shoulder blade to the other. His hands were monstrously hungry. His gaze was also starting to hunger, as if they had to look at something, anything, everything.
es_translation: So it was the hand that had started it all. He felt one hand and then the other unbuttoning his jacket and letting it fall to the floor. He held his pants over an abyss and let them fall into the darkness. His hands were hungry. And his eyes were starting to be as well, as if he needed to see something, anything, everything.

en: Wasn't there an old joke about the wife who talked so much on the telephone that her desperate husband ran out to the nearest store and telephoned her to ask what was for dinner? Well, then, why didn't he buy himself an audio-Seashell broadcasting station and talk to his wife late at night, murmur, whisper, shout, scream, yell? But what would he whisper, what would he yell? What could he say?
vi: Có phải là có một câu chuyện cười cũ kể về người vợ nói chuyện điện thoại nhiều đến nỗi anh chồng tuyệt vọng phải chạy ra cửa hàng gần nhất gọi điện cho cô ta hỏi xem bữa tối có món gì? Chậc, tại sao anh không tự mua cho mình một trạm phát Vỏ Sò rồi đêm đêm nói chuyện với cô, lẩm bẩm, thì thầm, la, hét, rú. Nhưng anh sẽ thì thầm cái gì, sẽ rú cái gì? Anh có thể nói gì?
tr: Eski bir fıkra vardır ya; adamın karısı telefonla o kadar çok konuşurmuş ki, ümitsiz koca en yakın dükkâna koşmuş ve karısına telefonla akşama yemekte ne var diye sormuş? Pekâlâ, öyleyse niçin bir kulaklık alıp radyo kanalıyla geceleri geç saatlerde mırıldanıp, fısıldayıp, bağırıp, haykırıp karısıyla konuşmuyordu? Fakat ne fısıldayacak, ne bağıracaktı? Ne söyleyebilirdi?
es: ¿No había un viejo chiste acerca de la mujer que hablaba tanto por teléfono que su esposo, desesperado, tuvo que correr a la tienda más próxima para telefonearle y preguntar qué había para la cena? Bueno, entonces, ¿por qué no se compraba él una emisora para radio auricular y hablaba con su esposa ya avanzada la noche, murmurando, susurrando, gritando, vociferando? Pero, ¿qué le susurraría, qué le chillaría? ¿Qué hubiese podido decirle?
vi_translation: Isn't there an old joke about the wife talking on the phone so much that the desperate husband has to run to the nearest store to call her and ask what's for dinner? Well, why doesn't he just get himself a Shell transmitter and talk to her every night, mumbling, whispering, shouting, screaming, howling. But what would he whisper, what would he howl? What could he say?
tr_translation: There is an old joke; the man's wife talked on the phone so much that the desperate husband ran to the nearest shop and asked his wife over the phone what was for dinner that evening? Well then, why didn't he get a headset and talk to his wife by murmuring, whispering, shouting, and yelling through a radio channel late at night? But what would he whisper, what would he shout? What could he say?
es_translation: Wasn't there an old joke about the woman who talked so much on the phone that her husband, desperate, had to run to the nearest store to call her and ask what was for dinner? Well, then, why didn't he buy himself a radio transmitter and talk to his wife late into the night, murmuring, whispering, shouting, yelling? But, what would he whisper to her, what would he shout? What could he have told her?

en: “No, not water; fire. You ever seen a burned house? It smoulders for days. Well, this fire'll last me the rest of my life. God! I've been trying to put it out, in my mind, all night. I'm crazy with trying.”
vi: "Không, không phải nước, mà là lửa. Em đã khi nào thấy một căn nhà bị đốt chưa? Nó cháy âm ỉ nhiều ngày liền. Ngọn lửa này nó sẽ cứ âm ỉ hoài cho đến hết đời anh. Chúa ơi! Anh đã ra sức cố dập cho nó tắt, trong đầu anh, suốt đêm. Anh cố gắng đến phát điên lên."
tr: “Hayır, su değil, ateş. Sen hiç yanmış bir ev gördün mü? Günlerce duman tüter. İşte, bu yangın bütün ömrüm boyunca sürecek. Tanrım! Bütün gece, kafamda onu söndürmeye çalışıp durdum. Delireceğim neredeyse.
es: —No, agua no, fuego. ¿Has visto alguna casa quemada? Humea durante días. Bueno, no olvidaré ese incendio en toda mi vida. ¡Dios! Me he pasado la noche tratando de apartarlo de mi cerebro. Estoy loco de tanto intentarlo.
vi_translation: "No, not water, but fire. Have you ever seen a house burn down? It smolders for many days. This fire will keep smoldering for the rest of my life. Oh God! I have tried my best to put it out, in my head, all night. I've tried so hard that I'm going crazy."
tr_translation: “No, not water, fire. Have you ever seen a burnt house? Smoke rises for days. Well, this fire will last my whole life. My God! All night, I kept trying to put it out in my head. I'm almost going crazy.”
es_translation: —No, not water, fire. Have you ever seen a burned house? It smokes for days. Well, I will never forget that fire in my entire life. God! I spent the whole night trying to get it out of my mind. I'm going crazy from trying so hard.

en: “Thought! “ he said. “Was I given a choice? My grandfather and father were firemen. In my sleep, I ran after them.”
vi: "Nghĩ!" anh nói. "Anh có được quyền chọn không? Ông của anh, bố của anh đều là lính phóng hỏa. Ngay cả lúc ngủ anh cũng thấy mình chạy theo họ."
tr: “Düşünmek mi?” dedi Montag. “Seçenek verdiler mi? Büyükbabam ve babam da itfaiyeciydi. Gözüm kapalı, onları takip ettim.
es: —¡Pensar! ¿Es que pude escoger? Mi abuelo y mi padre eran bomberos. En mi sueño, corrí tras ellos.
vi_translation: "Think!" he said. "Do I have the right to choose? His grandfather, his father were all firemen. Even when he sleeps, he sees himself running after them."
tr_translation: “Think?” said Montag. “Did they give a choice? My grandfather and father were also firefighters. With my eyes closed, I followed them.”
es_translation: —Thinking! Could I have chosen? My grandfather and my father were firefighters. In my dream, I ran after them.

en: “When did it all start, you ask, this job of ours, how did it come about, where, when? Well, I'd say it really got started around about a thing called the Civil War. Even though our rule-book claims it was founded earlier. The fact is we didn't get along well until photography came into its own. Then--motion pictures in the early twentieth century. Radio. Television. Things began to have mass.”
vi: "Nó bắt đầu từ khi nào, anh hỏi vậy, cái nghề này của chúng ta, nó đã xuất hiện ra sao, ở đâu, khi nào? Chắc tôi sẽ nói nó bắt đầu vào cái thòi diễn ra thứ gọi là Nội Chiến. Mặc dù cuốn nội quy của chúng ta thì bảo nghề này được thành lập sớm hơn. Sự thật là chúng ta không làm được gì mấy cho mãi tới khi nhiếp ảnh ra đời. Thế rồi phim ảnh vào đầu thế kỷ hai mươi. Radio. Truyền hình. Mọi thứ đều trở nên hàng loạt."
tr: “Bütün bunlar ne zaman başladı, diye soruyordun, bizim işimiz, nasıl ortaya çıktı, nerede, ne zaman? Gerçekten, ben de sana İç Savaş denilen şey civarında başladı, diyebilirim. Gerçi bizim kural kitabımız daha önce kurulduğunu öne sürüyor. Gerçek şu ki, fotoğrafçılık gelene kadar biz pek yol alamadık. Sonra, yirminci yüzyılın başlarında sinema doğdu. Radyo, televizyon. Artık kitleleri olmaya başladı.
es: —Me preguntarás, ¿cuándo empezó nuestra labor, cómo fue implantada, dónde, cómo? Bueno, yo diría que, en realidad, se inició aproximadamente con el acontecimiento llamado la Guerra Civil. Pese a que nuestros reglamentos afirman que fue fundada antes. En realidad es que no anduvimos muy bien hasta que la fotografía se implantó. Después las películas, a principios del siglo XX. Radio. Televisión. Las cosas empezaron a adquirir masa.
vi_translation: "When did it start, you ask, this profession of ours, how did it appear, where, when? I guess I would say it started during what is called the Civil War. Although our rulebook says this profession was established earlier. The truth is we didn't achieve much until the advent of photography. Then came films at the beginning of the twentieth century. Radio. Television. Everything became mass-produced."
tr_translation: “You were asking when all this started, how our work came about, where, when? Indeed, I can tell you it started around what is called the Civil War. Although our rule book suggests it was established earlier. The truth is, we didn't make much progress until photography came along. Then, in the early twentieth century, cinema was born. Radio, television. We began to have the masses.”
es_translation: —You may ask me, when did our work begin, how was it implemented, where, how? Well, I would say that, in reality, it started approximately with the event called the Civil War. Although our regulations state that it was founded earlier. The truth is that we didn't do very well until photography was implemented. Then movies, at the beginning of the 20th century. Radio. Television. Things started to gain momentum.

en: “No, I don't want to, this time. I want to hold on to this funny thing. God, it's gotten big on me. I don't know what it is. I'm so damned unhappy, I'm so mad, and I don't know why I feel like I'm putting on weight. I feel fat. I feel like I've been saving up a lot of things, and don't know what. I might even start reading books.”
vi: "Không, anh không muốn, lần này thì không. Anh muốn cứ giữ mãi cái thứ ngộ nghĩnh này, Chúa ơi, anh thích cái này quá. Anh chả biết nó là gì. Anh bất hạnh khủng khiếp, anh khùng điên, mà không biết tại sao. Anh thấy như mình đang lên cân. Anh thấy mình béo. Anh thấy mình đang tích cóp nhiều thứ, mà chẳng biết tích cóp cái gì. Có khi anh còn bắt đầu đọc sách nữa không chừng."
tr: “Hayır, istemiyorum, bu defa. Bu gülünç şeyin üstüne gitmek istiyorum. Tanrım, ne denli büyük benim için. Ne olduğunu bilemiyorum. Lanet derecede mutsuzum, öylesine deliyim. Neden bilmiyorum, kendimi kilo alıyormuşum gibi hissediyorum. Şişmanlamış gibi hissediyorum. Bir sürü şey toplamış, saklamışım gibi hissediyorum, ne olduğunu bilmiyorum. Belki de kitapları okumaya başlayabilirim.
es: —No, ahora no me apetece. Quiero estudiar esta sensación tan curiosa. ¡Caramba! ¡Me ha dado muy fuerte! No sé lo que es. ¡Me siento tan condenadamente infeliz, tan furioso! E ignoro por qué tengo la impresión de que estuviera ganando peso. Me siento gordo. Como si hubiese estado ahorrando una serie de cosas, y ahora no supiese cuáles. Incluso sería capaz de leer.
vi_translation: "No, I don't want to, not this time. I want to keep this quirky thing forever, oh God, I like this so much. I don't know what it is. I'm terribly unhappy, I'm crazy, and I don't know why. I feel like I'm gaining weight. I feel fat. I feel like I'm accumulating many things, but I don't know what I'm accumulating. Maybe I'll even start reading books."
tr_translation: “No, I don't want to, this time. I want to go after this ridiculous thing. My God, how immense it is for me. I don't know what it is. I am damned miserable, so insane. I don't know why, I feel like I'm gaining weight. I feel like I've gotten fat. I feel like I've collected and stored a lot of things, I don't know what they are. Maybe I can start reading books.”
es_translation: —No, I don't feel like it right now. I want to study this curious sensation. Wow! It has hit me really hard! I don't know what it is. I feel so damn unhappy, so furious! And I don't know why I have the impression that I am gaining weight. I feel fat. As if I had been saving up a series of things, and now I don't know what they are. I might even be able to read.

en: He spoke the words haltingly and with a terrible selfconsciousness. He read a dozen pages here and there and came at last to this:
vi: Anh nói câu đó một cách ngắc ngứ và sự lúng túng khủng khiếp. Anh đọc mươi trang đây đó và rồi cuối cùng đến câu này:
tr: Sözcükleri kesik kesik söylüyordu ve yaptığı şey onu çok huzursuz ediyordu. Bir düzine sayfayı parça parça okudu, sonunda şuna rastladı:
es: Balanceó estas palabras con terrible concentración. Leyó una docena de páginas salteadas y, por último, encontró esto:
vi_translation: He said that sentence in a stammering manner and with terrible awkwardness. He read a few pages here and there and finally came to this sentence:
tr_translation: He was speaking the words haltingly, and what he was doing made him very uneasy. He read through a dozen pages piece by piece, and finally came across this:
es_translation: He balanced these words with terrible concentration. He read a dozen scattered pages and, finally, found this:

en: “ `We cannot tell the precise moment when friendship is formed. As in filling a vessel drop by drop, there is at last a drop which makes it run over, so in a series of kindnesses there is at last one which makes the heart run over.'“
vi: " 'Chúng ta không thể biết đâu mới đứng là khoảnh khắc tình bạn được thành hình. Như thể đổ đầy một bình chứa từng giọt từng giọt một, có một giọt cuối cùng làm cho bình đầy quá tràn ra; cũng vậy trong một chuỗi những ân cần tử tế rốt cuộc sẽ có một cử chỉ ân cần tử tế làm cho trái tim đầy tràn.' "3[1]
tr: ‘Bir dostluğun tam olarak başladığı anı bilemeyiz. Bir kabın içine damla damla dolar gibi, sonunda o bir tek damla kabı taşırır. Böylece iyilikler dizisinin sonunda bir bir iyilik olur ki, insanın yüreği dolar taşar.
es: No podemos determinar el momento concreto en que nace la amistad. Como al llenar un recipiente gota a gota, hay una gota final que lo hace desbordarse, del mismo modo, en una serie de gentilezas hay una final que acelera los latidos del corazón...
vi_translation: " 'We can never know which moment is the one when friendship is formed. Like filling a container drop by drop, there is one last drop that makes it overflow; similarly, in a series of kind acts, there will eventually be one kind gesture that makes the heart overflow.' "3[1]
tr_translation: “‘We can never know the exact moment a friendship begins. Just like a vessel filling drop by drop, eventually, a single drop makes it overflow. In the same way, at the end of a series of kindnesses, there comes one final kindness that fills and overflows the human heart.’”
es_translation: We cannot determine the exact moment when friendship is born. Just as when filling a container drop by drop, there is a final drop that makes it overflow, in the same way, in a series of kindnesses, there is one final act that quickens the heartbeat...

en: The bombers crossed the sky and crossed the sky over the house, gasping, murmuring, whistling like an immense, invisible fan, circling in emptiness.
vi: Những chiếc máy bay ném bom băng qua bầu trời và lại băng qua bầu trời phía trên căn nhà, thở hồng hộc, lầm bầm, huýt sáo như một cái quạt lớn mênh mông, vô hình, xoay vòng vòng trong chốn trống không.
tr: Bombardıman uçakları, boşlukta dönen, çok büyük, göze görünmez bir pervane gibi kesik kesik soluk alarak, homurdanarak, ıslık çalarak gökyüzünden, evin üstündeki gökyüzünden geçtiler.
es: Los bombarderos atravesaron el cielo, sobre la casa, silbando, murmurando, como un ventilador inmenso e invisible que girara en el vacío.
vi_translation: The bombers crossed the sky and crossed the sky again above the house, panting, mumbling, whistling like a vast, invisible fan, spinning around in the empty space.
tr_translation: Bombers, rotating in the void like a very large, invisible propeller, passed through the sky above the house, breathing intermittently, grumbling, and whistling.
es_translation: The bombers crossed the sky, over the house, whistling, murmuring, like an immense and invisible fan spinning in the void.

en: Hold on. He shut his eyes. Yes, of course. Again he found himself thinking of the green park a year ago. The thought had been with him many times recently, but now he remembered how it was that day in the city park when he had seen that old man in the black suit hide something, quickly in his coat .
vi: Bình tĩnh. Anh nhắm mắt. Phải, dĩ nhiên. Một lần nữa anh thấy mình đang nghĩ về công viên xanh cách đây một năm. Dạo này ý nghĩ đó cứ ở trong anh nhưng lúc này anh nhớ lại ngày hôm đó trong công viên thành phố anh đã thấy người đàn ông mặc com lê đen giấu vội cái gì đó vào bên trong áo.
tr: Dur, bir düşün. Gözlerini kapattı. Evet, elbette. Tekrar, bir yıl önceki yeşil parkı düşündüğünü fark etti. Son zamanlarda bu düşünce sık sık aklına geliyordu, fakat şimdi, şehir parkında gördüğü o siyah elbiseli adamın siyah ceketinin içine çabucak bir şey sakladığını hatırladı.
es: Aguardó. Montag cerró los ojos. Sí, desde luego. Volvió a encontrarse pensando en el verde parque un año atrás. Últimamente, aquel pensamiento había acudido muchas veces a su mente, pero, en aquel momento, recordó con claridad aquel día en el parque de la ciudad, cuando vio a aquel viejo vestido de negro que ocultaba algo, con rapidez, bajo su chaqueta.
vi_translation: Calm down. He closed his eyes. Yes, of course. Once again, he found himself thinking about the green park from a year ago. These days, that thought kept lingering in him, but at this moment, he recalled that day in the city park when he saw a man in a black suit hurriedly hiding something inside his coat.
tr_translation: Stop, think for a moment. He closed his eyes. Yes, of course. Again, he realized he was thinking about the green park from a year ago. Lately, this thought had been coming to his mind frequently, but now, he remembered that the man in the black suit he saw in the city park had quickly hidden something inside his black jacket.
es_translation: He waited. Montag closed his eyes. Yes, of course. He found himself thinking again about the green park a year ago. Lately, that thought had come to his mind many times, but at that moment, he clearly remembered that day in the city park, when he saw that old man dressed in black who quickly hid something under his jacket.

en: I'm numb, he thought. When did the numbness really begin in my face? In my body? The night I kicked the pill-bottle in the dark, like kicking a buried mine.
vi: Mình tê liệt rồi, anh nghĩ. Cảm giác tê liệt này thật ra bắt đầu nơi mặt mình từ lúc nào? Trong cơ thể mình? Cái đêm mình đá chai thuốc trong bóng tối, như đá một quả mìn được chôn.
tr: Uyuşuğun biriyim, diye düşündü. Bu uyuşukluk yüzümde, bedenimde gerçekte ne zaman başladı? Gömülü bir mayını tekmeler gibi, karanlıkta ilaç şişesini tekmelediğim o gece.
es: «Me siento entumecido —pensó—. ¿Cuándo ha empezado ese entumecimiento en mi rostro, en mi cuerpo? La noche en que, en la oscuridad, di un puntapié a la botella de píldoras, y fue como si hubiera pisado una mina enterrada.
vi_translation: I'm paralyzed, he thought. When did this feeling of paralysis actually start on my face? In my body? The night I kicked the bottle of medicine in the dark, like kicking a buried mine.
tr_translation: I'm such a slacker, he thought. When did this sluggishness really start on my face, in my body? That night when I kicked the medicine bottle in the dark, like kicking a buried mine.
es_translation: “I feel numb,” he thought. “When did this numbness start in my face, in my body?” The night when, in the darkness, I kicked the pill bottle, and it was as if I had stepped on a buried mine.

en: The subway fled past him, cream-tile, jet-black, cream-tile, jet-black, numerals and darkness, more darkness and the total adding itself.
vi: Hầm xe điện ngầm lao qua anh, lát gạch màu kem, đen nhánh, lát gạch màu kem, đen nhánh, những con số và bóng tối, thêm nhiều bóng tối và rồi thêm nhiều lần bóng tối nữa.
tr: Metro hızla gelip geçti, krem renkli çiniler, simsiyah, krem renkli çiniler, simsiyah sayılar ve karanlık, daha fazla karanlık ve gitgide büyüyen toplam.
es: El convoy pasó veloz frente a él, crema, negro, crema, negro, números y oscuridad, más oscuridad y el total sumándose a sí mismo.
vi_translation: The subway tunnel rushed past him, cream-colored tiles, jet black, cream-colored tiles, jet black, numbers and darkness, more darkness and then even more darkness again.
tr_translation: The metro came and went quickly, cream-colored tiles, pitch black, cream-colored tiles, pitch black numbers and darkness, more darkness and an ever-growing total.
es_translation: The convoy sped past him, cream, black, cream, black, numbers and darkness, more darkness and the total adding up to itself.

en: “Number one: Do you know why books such as this are so important? Because they have quality. And what does the word quality mean? To me it means texture. This book has pores. It has features. This book can go under the microscope. You'd find life under the glass, streaming past in infinite profusion. The more pores, the more truthfully recorded details of life per square inch you can get on a sheet of paper, the more `literary' you are. That's my definition, anyway. Telling detail. Fresh detail. The good writers touch life often. The mediocre ones run a quick hand over her. The bad ones rape her and leave her for the flies.
vi: "Thứ nhất: Anh có biết vì sao nhũng cuốn sách như thế này lại quan trọng đến thế không? Vì chúng có phẩm chất. Và từ phẩm chất có nghĩa là gì? Với tôi nó có nghĩa là kết cấu. Sách này có những lỗ chân lông. Nó có những đặc tính. Sách này có thể cho vào dưới kính hiển vi. Anh sẽ tìm thấy sự sống dưới ống kính, tuôn chảy, tràn trề vô tận. Càng có nhiều lỗ chân lông, chi tiết sự sống trên từng phân vuông mà ta có thể ghi nhận trên một tờ giấy lại càng chân thật hơn, anh lại càng 'có chữ' hơn. Dù sao thì đó là định nghĩa của tôi. Cho biết chỉ tiết. Chi tiết tươi mới. Văn hay thường xuyên chạm vào đời sống. Văn tầm tầm chỉ phớt qua đời sống. Văn tồi thì hãm hiếp đòi sống rồi bỏ nàng đó cho ruồi.
tr: “Bir: Bunun gibi kitapların neden çok önemli olduğunu biliyor musun? Çünkü onlar nitelikliler. Peki nitelik sözcüğünün anlamı nedir? Bana göre dokusudur. Bu kitabın gözenekleri var. Özellikleri var. Bu kitap mikroskop altına girebilir. Camın altında sonsuz bir bollukla geçen bir yaşam bulursun. Ne kadar çok gözenek olursa, bir yaprak kâğıt üzerine her santimetrekare için doğrulukla kaydedilmiş yaşama ilişkin daha çok olur ve sen daha çok “yazınsal” olursun. Neyse, bu benim tarifim. Ayrıntıyı anlatmak. Yeni ayrıntıları. İyi yazarlar yaşama sık sık dokunurlar. Ortalama yazarlar üstüne hafifçe dokunup geçerler. Kötü olanlar ona tecavüz edip, leşini sineklere bırakır.
es: »Primera: ¿Sabe por qué libros como éste son tan importantes? Porque tienen calidad. Y, ¿qué significa la palabra calidad? Para mí, significa textura. Este libro tiene poros, tiene facciones. Este libro puede colocarse bajo el microscopio. A través de la lente encontraría vida, huellas del pasado en infinita profusión. Cuantos más poros, más detalles de la vida verídicamente registrados puede obtener de cada hoja de papel, cuanto más «literario» se vea. En todo caso, ésa es mi definición. Detalle revelador. Detalle reciente. Los buenos escultores tocan la vida a menudo. Los mediocres sólo pasan apresuradamente la mano por encima de ella. Los malos violan y la dejan por inútil.
vi_translation: "First: Do you know why books like these are so important? Because they have quality. And what does quality mean? To me, it means texture. This book has pores. It has features. This book can be put under a microscope. You will find life under the lens, flowing, endlessly abundant. The more pores there are, the more detailed the life on each square inch of paper that we can record, the more 'literate' you become. Anyway, that's my definition. Provide details. Fresh details. Good literature often touches life. Average literature merely brushes over life. Bad literature rapes life and leaves her for the flies.
tr_translation: “One: Do you know why books like this are so important? Because they are of high quality. So, what is the meaning of the word quality? To me, it is texture. This book has pores. It has features. This book can go under a microscope. Under the glass, you find a life passing with infinite abundance. The more pores there are, the more life accurately recorded per square centimeter on a sheet of paper, and the more 'literary' you become. Anyway, that's my definition. To describe the detail. New details. Good writers frequently touch life. Average writers touch it lightly and pass over it. Bad ones rape it and leave its corpse for the flies.
es_translation: »First: Do you know why books like this one are so important? Because they have quality. And, what does the word quality mean? To me, it means texture. This book has pores, it has features. This book can be placed under the microscope. Through the lens, you would find life, traces of the past in infinite profusion. The more pores, the more details of life truthfully recorded you can obtain from each sheet of paper, the more "literary" it looks. In any case, that is my definition. Revealing detail. Recent detail. Good sculptors often touch life. The mediocre ones just hurriedly pass their hand over it. The bad ones violate it and leave it useless.

en: Outside, crossing the lawn, on his way to work, he tried not to see how completely dark and deserted Clarisse McClellan's house was ....
vi: Bên ngoài, trong khi băng qua bãi cỏ, trên đường đi làm, anh cố tránh không nhìn ngôi nhà của Clarisse McClellan hoàn toàn tối om và vắng lặng ra sao...
tr: Dışarda, işine gitmek için, çimenliği aşarken, Clarisse McClellan’ın evinin ne kadar karanlık ve terk edilmiş olduğunu görmemeye çalıştı...
es: Fuera, atravesando el césped, mientras se dirigía hacia su trabajo, Montag trató de no ver cuán completamente oscura y desierta estaba la casa de Clarisse McClellan...
vi_translation: Outside, while crossing the lawn on his way to work, he tried to avoid looking at how completely dark and silent Clarisse McClellan's house was...
tr_translation: Outside, while crossing the lawn to go to work, he tried not to notice how dark and abandoned Clarisse McClellan's house was...
es_translation: Outside, crossing the lawn, as he headed towards his work, Montag tried not to see how completely dark and deserted Clarisse McClellan's house was...

en: It was good listening to the beetle hum, the sleepy mosquito buzz and delicate filigree murmur of the old man's voice at first scolding him and then consoling him in the late hour of night as he emerged from the steaming subway toward the firehouse world.
vi: Thật dễ chịu khi nghe tiếng rù rù như ong kêu, viếng vo vo buồn ngủ như tiếng muỗi và tiếng thì thầm mỏng tang vấn vít của giọng ông già lúc đầu mắng mỏ anh rồi sau an ủi anh lúc đêm về sáng khi anh từ tàu điện tỏa khói chui ra đi về phía thế giới trạm phóng hỏa.
tr: Buğulu metrodan çıkıp itfaiye dünyasına doğru yol alırken, gecenin bu geç saatinde böceğin vınlaması, uykulu sivrisineğin vızıldaması ve önce onu azarlayan sonra yatıştıran nazik, ince mırıltıyı dinlemek çok güzeldi.
es: Era agradable escuchar el ronroneo del aparatito, el zumbido de mosquito adormilado y el delicado murmullo de la voz del viejo, primero, riñéndole y, después, consolándole, a aquella hora tan avanzada de la noche, mientras salía del caluroso «Metro» y se dirigía hacia el mundo del cuartel de bomberos.
vi_translation: It's quite pleasant to hear the buzzing like bees, the sleepy drone like mosquitoes, and the thin, lingering whisper of the old man's voice, initially scolding you and then comforting you as night turns to dawn, when you emerge from the smoke-emitting tram and head towards the world of the fire-launching station.
tr_translation: As he exited the foggy metro and headed towards the world of the fire brigade, it was very pleasant to listen to the whirring of the insect, the buzzing of the sleepy mosquito, and the gentle, soft murmur that first scolded him and then soothed him, at this late hour of the night.
es_translation: It was pleasant to hear the purring of the little device, the drowsy mosquito buzz, and the delicate murmur of the old man's voice, first scolding him and then consoling him, at such a late hour of the night, as he left the hot "Metro" and headed towards the world of the fire station.

en: “Or this? 'A little learning is a dangerous thing. Drink deep, or taste not the Pierian spring; There shallow draughts intoxicate the brain, and drinking largely sobers us again.' Pope. Same Essay. Where does that put you?”
vi: "Hay cái này? 'Một ít hiểu biết là thứ nguy hiểm. Hãy uống cho sâu, nếu không thì đừng nếm dòng Pieria. Những hớp nước cỏn con sẽ làm đầu óc ta say mèm, và uống thật nhiều sẽ giúp chúng ta tỉnh lại.’15[5] Pope. Cũng tiểu luận ấy. Anh thấy nó thế nào?"
tr: “Ya da şu? ‘Yetersiz bilgi tehlikeli bir şeydir. Ya çok iç ya da Pieria kaynağını hiç tatma. Orada sığ sulardan bir yudum bile beyni zehirler, çok içince de bizi yeniden kendimize getirir.’ Pope. Aynı yazı. Bu seni nereye yerleştiriyor?
es: —¿O de esto? Un poco de instrucción es peligrosa. Bebe copiosamente, o no pruebes el manantial de la sabiduría; esas corrientes profundas intoxican el cerebro, y beber en abundancia nos vuelve a serenar. Pope. El mismo ensayo. ¿Dónde te deja esto?
vi_translation: "How about this? 'A little learning is a dangerous thing. Drink deep, or taste not the Pierian spring. There shallow draughts intoxicate the brain, and drinking largely sobers us again.’15[5] Pope. The same essay. What do you think of it?"
tr_translation: “Or this? ‘A little learning is a dangerous thing. Drink deep, or taste not the Pierian spring. There shallow draughts intoxicate the brain, and drinking largely sobers us again.’ Pope. The same writing. Where does this place you?”
es_translation: —Or this? A little learning is a dangerous thing. Drink deeply, or taste not the Pierian spring; there shallow draughts intoxicate the brain, and drinking largely sobers us again. Pope. The same essay. Where does this leave you?

en: A great nuzzling gout of flame leapt out to lap at the books and knock them against the wall. He stepped into the bedroom and fired twice and the twin beds went up in a great simmering whisper, with more heat and passion and light than he would have supposed them to contain. He burnt the bedroom walls and the cosmetics chest because he wanted to change everything, the chairs, the tables, and in the dining-room the silverware and plastic dishes, everything that showed that he had lived here in this empty house with a strange woman who would forget him tomorrow, who had gone and quite forgotten him already, listening to her Seashell radio pour in on her and in on her as she rode across town, alone. And as before, it was good to burn, he felt himself gush out in the fire, snatch, rend, rip in half with flame, and put away the senseless problem. If there was no solution, well then now there was no problem, either. Fire was best for everything!
vi: Một dòng lửa tướng phụt ra xồ tới ngoạm những cuốn sách và đập chúng vào tường. Anh bước vào phòng ngủ mà phóng lửa hai lần, chiếc giường đôi liền bùng cháy phát ra tiếng xèo xèo nho nhỏ tuyệt vòi, với bao nhiêu là sức nóng và đam mê và ánh sáng, anh chưa hề nghĩ là trong chúng lại có thể có ngần ấy sức nóng và đam mê và ánh sáng. Anh đốt các bức tường phòng ngủ đốt tủ đồ mỹ phẩm vì anh muốn thay đổi mọi thứ, những cái ghế, những cái bàn, và trong phòng ăn thì anh đốt bộ đồ ăn bằng bạc và các đĩa nhựa, tất cả những gì cho thấy anh đã sống nơi đây trong căn nhà trống rỗng này với một người đàn bà xa lạ chỉ ngày mai thôi là sẽ quên anh, người đàn bà đã ra đi và đã gần quên anh rồi, đang nghe cái Radio vỏ Sò rót vào tai cô rót mãi vào tai cô trong khi cô ngồi xe băng ngang qua thành phố, một mình. Và cũng như trước, đốt thế này thật dễ chịu, anh cảm thấy bản thân mình phụt ra trong ngọn lửa, giằng, rứt, xé làm đôi cùng ngọn lửa, và diệt quách cái vấn đề vô nghĩa ấy đi. Nếu đã chẳng có giải pháp nào thì giờ cũng chẳng có vấn đề nào nốt. Lửa là tốt nhất cho mọi thứ!
tr: “Ateş!” Büyük bir ateş dili uzanarak kitapları yaladı ve onları karşı duvara fırlattı. Montag yatak odasına girdi, iki kere ateş etti ve ikiz yataklar büyük bir tıslamayla, onlarda bulunduğunu sandığından daha fazlı ısı, öfke ve ışıkla patlayarak havaya fırladılar. Yatak odasının duvarlarını, kozmetik kutusunu yaktı, çünkü her şeyi, iskemleleri, masaları ve yemek odasındaki gümüş eşyayı, plastik tabak çanağı, bir zamanlar burada, bu boş evde, kendisini yarın unutacak olan, gitmiş ve onu herhalde unutmaya başlamış olan, kulağındaki Deniz Kabuğu’nu dinleyen ve şehirde yalnız dolaşırken de radyosu kulağında olan, garip bir kadınla birlikte yaşamış olduğunu gösteren her şeyi değiştirmek istiyordu. Ve eskiden olduğu gibi, yakmak güzel bir şeydi, kendisini ateşin içinden fışkırıyormuş gibi, kavrayıcı kopartıcı, yırtıcı ve mantıksız sorunlardan uzak hissetti. Eğer bir çözüm yoksa, o zaman bir sorun da yok demekti. Ateş her sorun için en iyi çareydi!
es: —¡Fuego! Un chorro llameante salió desde la boquilla del aparato y golpeó los libros contra la pared. Montag entró en el dormitorio y disparó dos veces, y las camas gemelas se volatilizaron exhalando un susurro, con más calor, pasión y luz de las que él había supuesto que pudiesen contener. Montag quemó las paredes del dormitorio, el tocador, porque quería cambiarlo todo, las sillas, las mesas; y, en el comedor, los platos de plástico y de plata, todo lo que indicara que él había vivido allí, en aquella casa vacía, con una mujer desconocida que mañana le olvidaría, que se había marchado y le había olvidado ya por completo, escuchando su radio auricular mientras atravesaba la ciudad, sola. Y como antes, era bueno quemar. Montag se sintió borbotear en las llamas y el insensato problema fue arrebatado, destruido, dividido y ahuyentado. Si no había solución... Bueno, en tal caso, tampoco quedaría problema. ¡El fuego era lo mejor para todos!
vi_translation: A stream of fire burst out, rushing to devour the books and slam them against the wall. He stepped into the bedroom and shot fire twice, the double bed immediately burst into flames with a small sizzling sound, with so much heat and passion and light, he had never thought that there could be so much heat and passion and light in them. He burned the bedroom walls, burned the vanity because he wanted to change everything, the chairs, the tables, and in the dining room, he burned the silverware and the plastic plates, everything that showed he had lived here in this empty house with a strange woman who by tomorrow would forget him, the woman who had left and had nearly forgotten him already, listening to the Seashell Radio pouring into her ears, pouring endlessly into her ears as she sat in a car driving across the city, alone. And just like before, burning like this felt so pleasant, he felt himself burst out in the fire, tearing, wrenching, splitting in two with the fire, and completely annihilating that meaningless problem. If there was no solution, then now there was no problem either. Fire is the best for everything!
tr_translation: A large tongue of fire reached out, licking the books and hurling them against the opposite wall. Montag entered the bedroom, fired twice, and the twin beds, with a great hiss, exploded into the air with more heat, anger, and light than he had thought they contained. He burned the walls of the bedroom, the cosmetics box, because he wanted to change everything that showed he had once lived here, in this empty house, with a strange woman who would forget him tomorrow, who had left and probably already started to forget him, who listened to the Seashell in her ear and wandered alone in the city with her radio in her ear: the chairs, the tables, the silverware in the dining room, the plastic dishes. And as before, burning was a beautiful thing, he felt as if he were bursting forth from the fire, away from the grasping, tearing, predatory, and irrational problems. If there was no solution, then it meant there was no problem either. Fire was the best remedy for every problem!”
es_translation: A blazing jet shot out from the nozzle of the device and struck the books against the wall. Montag entered the bedroom and fired twice, and the twin beds vaporized, exhaling a whisper, with more heat, passion, and light than he had supposed they could contain. Montag burned the bedroom walls, the dresser, because he wanted to change everything, the chairs, the tables; and, in the dining room, the plastic and silver plates, everything that indicated he had lived there, in that empty house, with an unknown woman who would forget him tomorrow, who had already left and completely forgotten him, listening to her ear radio as she crossed the city, alone. And as before, it was good to burn. Montag felt himself bubbling in the flames and the senseless problem was snatched away, destroyed, divided, and driven away. If there was no solution... Well, in that case, there would be no problem either. Fire was the best for everyone!

en: And then he came to the parlour where the great idiot monsters lay asleep with their white thoughts and their snowy dreams. And he shot a bolt at each of the three blank walls and the vacuum hissed out at him. The emptiness made an even emptier whistle, a senseless scream. He tried to think about the vacuum upon which the nothingness had performed, but he could not. He held his breath so the vacuum could not get into his lungs. He cut off its terrible emptiness, drew back, and gave the entire room a gift of one huge bright yellow flower of burning. The fire-proof plastic sheath on everything was cut wide and the house began to shudder with flame.
